speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: SCENE IV. A street.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and the Officer

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Fear me not, man; I will not break away:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I'll give thee, ere I leave thee, so much money,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To warrant thee, as I am 'rested for.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: My wife is in a wayward mood to-day,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And will not lightly trust the messenger

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That I should be attach'd in Ephesus,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I tell you, 'twill sound harshly in her ears.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter DROMIO of Ephesus with a rope's-end

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Here comes my man; I think he brings the money.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: How now, sir! have you that I sent you for?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Here's that, I warrant you, will pay them all.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But where's the money?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Why, sir, I gave the money for the rope.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Five hundred ducats, villain, for a rope?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I'll serve you, sir, five hundred at the rate.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To what end did I bid thee hie thee home?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To a rope's-end, sir; and to that end am I returned.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And to that end, sir, I will welcome you.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Beating him

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Good sir, be patient.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, 'tis for me to be patient; I am in adversity.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Good, now, hold thy tongue.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Nay, rather persuade him to hold his hands.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou whoreson, senseless villain!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I would I were senseless, sir, that I might not feel

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: your blows.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: Thou art sensible in nothing but blows, and so is an

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS
text_entry: ass.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I am an ass, indeed; you may prove it by my long

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ears. I have served him from the hour of my

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: nativity to this instant, and have nothing at his

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: hands for my service but blows. When I am cold, he

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: heats me with beating; when I am warm, he cools me

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: with beating; I am waked with it when I sleep;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: raised with it when I sit; driven out of doors with

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: it when I go from home; welcomed home with it when

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I return; nay, I bear it on my shoulders, as a

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: beggar wont her brat; and, I think when he hath

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: lamed me, I shall beg with it from door to door.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Come, go along; my wife is coming yonder.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter ADRIANA, LUCIANA, the Courtezan, and PINCH

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Mistress, 'respice finem,' respect your end; or

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: rather, the prophecy like the parrot, 'beware the

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: rope's-end.'

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Wilt thou still talk?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Beating him

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: How say you now? is not your husband mad?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: His incivility confirms no less.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Good Doctor Pinch, you are a conjurer;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Establish him in his true sense again,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And I will please you what you will demand.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Alas, how fiery and how sharp he looks!

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Mark how he trembles in his ecstasy!

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: Give me your hand and let me feel your pulse.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: There is my hand, and let it feel your ear.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Striking him

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: I charge thee, Satan, housed within this man,

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: To yield possession to my holy prayers

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: And to thy state of darkness hie thee straight:

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: I conjure thee by all the saints in heaven!

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Peace, doting wizard, peace! I am not mad.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: O, that thou wert not, poor distressed soul!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: You minion, you, are these your customers?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Did this companion with the saffron face

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Revel and feast it at my house to-day,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Whilst upon me the guilty doors were shut

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And I denied to enter in my house?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: O husband, God doth know you dined at home;

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Where would you had remain'd until this time,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Free from these slanders and this open shame!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Dined at home! Thou villain, what sayest thou?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Sir, sooth to say, you did not dine at home.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Were not my doors lock'd up and I shut out?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Perdie, your doors were lock'd and you shut out.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And did not she herself revile me there?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Sans fable, she herself reviled you there.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Did not her kitchen-maid rail, taunt, and scorn me?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Certes, she did; the kitchen-vestal scorn'd you.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And did not I in rage depart from thence?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: In verity you did; my bones bear witness,

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That since have felt the vigour of his rage.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Is't good to soothe him in these contraries?

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: It is no shame: the fellow finds his vein,

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: And yielding to him humours well his frenzy.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Thou hast suborn'd the goldsmith to arrest me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Alas, I sent you money to redeem you,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: By Dromio here, who came in haste for it.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Money by me! heart and goodwill you might;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But surely master, not a rag of money.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Went'st not thou to her for a purse of ducats?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He came to me and I deliver'd it.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: And I am witness with her that she did.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: God and the rope-maker bear me witness

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That I was sent for nothing but a rope!

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: Mistress, both man and master is possess'd;

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: I know it by their pale and deadly looks:

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: They must be bound and laid in some dark room.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Say, wherefore didst thou lock me forth to-day?

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And why dost thou deny the bag of gold?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I did not, gentle husband, lock thee forth.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And, gentle master, I received no gold;

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But I confess, sir, that we were lock'd out.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Dissembling villain, thou speak'st false in both.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Dissembling harlot, thou art false in all;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: And art confederate with a damned pack

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To make a loathsome abject scorn of me:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: But with these nails I'll pluck out these false eyes

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: That would behold in me this shameful sport.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Enter three or four, and offer to bind him. He strives

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: O, bind him, bind him! let him not come near me.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: More company! The fiend is strong within him.

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: Ay me, poor man, how pale and wan he looks!

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: What, will you murder me? Thou gaoler, thou,

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: I am thy prisoner: wilt thou suffer them

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: To make a rescue?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Masters, let him go

speaker: Officer
text_entry: He is my prisoner, and you shall not have him.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: Go bind this man, for he is frantic too.

speaker: PINCH
text_entry: They offer to bind Dromio of Ephesus

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: What wilt thou do, thou peevish officer?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Hast thou delight to see a wretched man

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Do outrage and displeasure to himself?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: He is my prisoner: if I let him go,

speaker: Officer
text_entry: The debt he owes will be required of me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I will discharge thee ere I go from thee:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Bear me forthwith unto his creditor,

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And, knowing how the debt grows, I will pay it.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Good master doctor, see him safe convey'd

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Home to my house. O most unhappy day!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: O most unhappy strumpet!

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Master, I am here entered in bond for you.

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Out on thee, villain! wherefore dost thou mad me?

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: Will you be bound for nothing? be mad, good master:

speaker: DROMIO OF EPHESUS
text_entry: cry 'The devil!'

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: God help, poor souls, how idly do they talk!

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Go bear him hence. Sister, go you with me.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Exeunt all but Adriana, Luciana, Officer and Courtezan

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Say now, whose suit is he arrested at?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: One Angelo, a goldsmith: do you know him?

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I know the man. What is the sum he owes?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Two hundred ducats.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Say, how grows it due?

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Due for a chain your husband had of him.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: He did bespeak a chain for me, but had it not.

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: When as your husband all in rage to-day

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Came to my house and took away my ring--

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: The ring I saw upon his finger now--

speaker: Courtezan
text_entry: Straight after did I meet him with a chain.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: It may be so, but I did never see it.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Come, gaoler, bring me where the goldsmith is:

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: I long to know the truth hereof at large.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse with his rapier drawn, and DROMIO of Syracuse

speaker: LUCIANA
text_entry: God, for thy mercy! they are loose again.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: And come with naked swords.

speaker: ADRIANA
text_entry: Let's call more help to have them bound again.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Away! they'll kill us.

speaker: Officer
text_entry: Exeunt all but Antipholus of Syracuse and Dromio of Syracuse

speaker: Officer
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I see these witches are afraid of swords.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: She that would be your wife now ran from you.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Come to the Centaur; fetch our stuff from thence:

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I long that we were safe and sound aboard.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Faith, stay here this night; they will surely do us

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: no harm: you saw they speak us fair, give us gold:

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: methinks they are such a gentle nation that, but for

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: the mountain of mad flesh that claims marriage of

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: me, I could find in my heart to stay here still and

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: turn witch.

speaker: DROMIO OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: ANTIPHOLUS

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: I will not stay to-night for all the town;

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Therefore away, to get our stuff aboard.

speaker: ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE
text_entry: Exeunt
